alert.note: Alert for Riverside County Mountains; San Bernardino County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 24 at 3:38AM PST until February 25 at 4:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding from excessive rainfall is most likely Saturday. * WHERE...Orange County, Riverside County Mountains and Valleys, San Bernardino County Mountains and Valleys, and the San Gorgonio Pass Near Banning. * WHEN...From 1 PM this afternoon through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A winter storm will bring rainfall to the area today and Saturday. The heaviest rain will fall on Saturday when rain rates of 0.50 to 0.75 inches per hour are expected. The highest rain rates will be on the southwest facing mountain slopes below the snow level. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Monitor forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Riverside County Mountains; San Bernardino County Mountains
